network.packet

Class FloatingPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • network.packet.Packet
      • network.packet.FloatingPacket

  • public class FloatingPacket
extends Packet
    Since:
    7-4-15 Extends Packet, a floating packet has a timestamp.

    A floating packet represents an unacknowledged packet: - If the timestamp is reached, a new packet is constructed from this object. - This new packet is sent again and the timestamp is refreshed.

    Author:
    Tim Hintzbergen
